comments:
On startup of eclipse, with a RefreshProvider plugin, I find that my
RefreshProvider class is instantiated twice.  This was discovered by trace
logging placed into my RefreshProvider constructor.  The trace log is included.
 I then placed a "new Runtime.printStackTrace()" into the constructor in hopes
of resolving additional line numbers and the double instantiation ceased.  The
result of that trace follows the two trace log entries at the bottom of this note.



!SESSION Jan 18, 2005 11:36:29.364 ---------------------------------------------

java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US

The double instantiation was occuring at the beginning of each session.  After
submitting this bug, it stopped doing it, though.  I've checked the xml files
and have as yet to see anything obvious
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 83145 ***
